edu.rit.pj2

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.Rule

  • public class Rule
extends Object
    Class Rule provides a PJ2 rule. A PJ2 parallel program is either a single task (a subclass of class Task) or is a number of tasks grouped together into a job (a subclass of class Job). In the latter case, the job consists of a number of rules, which are instances of class Rule or a subclass thereof.

    A PJ2 job maintains a repository of Tuples known as tuple space. The job's execution is driven by firing the rules, based on tuples that are written into tuple space.

    Programming rules. To create a rule:

    • Obtain an instance of class Rule by calling the rule() method in the main() method of a Job.

    • Specify the condition for firing the rule, one of the following:

      • Start rule—To fire the rule once when the job starts, call the atStart() method. If the firing condition is not specified, the rule is a start rule by default.

      • On-demand rule—To fire the rule when a certain tuple or tuples are present in tuple space, call the whenMatch() method one or more times, specifying the template or templates to match against the tuples.

        Optionally, call the matcher() method to override the default tuple matching algorithm. See below for further information.

      • Finish rule—To fire the rule once when the job finishes, call the atFinish() method.

    • Call the task(Class) method and/or the task(int,Class) method one or more times to specify the task or tasks in the rule's task group. When the rule fires, all of the rule's tasks will be executed as a single group. For further information about creating a task specification, see class TaskSpec.

    Rule execution. The rules are fired as follows:

    • For a start rule, the rule is fired once when the job starts. For each task in the rule's task group, an instance of the task subclass is constructed, and the task's main() method is called, passing in the task's command line arguments. The task may read and take tuples from tuple space and put tuples into tuple space.

    • For an on-demand rule, the rule is fired whenever tuples exist in tuple space that match the rule's templates. An on-demand rule may fire more than once during the course of a job. When the rule fires, the matching tuples are automatically taken out of tuple space. For each task in the rule's task group, an instance of the task subclass is constructed, and the task's main() method is called, passing in the task's command line arguments. The task may obtain the matching tuples that caused the on-demand rule to fire. The task may also read and take tuples from tuple space and put tuples into tuple space.

      The default algorithm to decide whether there are tuples in tuple space that match the templates in the rule is to consider each template separately, in the order the templates were added to the rule. For each template, the tuples in tuple space are considered in the order the tuples were added to tuple space. If the template matches a tuple, as determined by the template's match() method, the matching tuple is remembered, and the next template is considered. Each template must match a different tuple. If a matching tuple cannot be found for one or more templates, the rule is not fired. If a matching tuple is found for every template, the matching tuples are removed from tuple space, the rule is fired, and copies of the matching tuples are provided to each of the tasks in the task group.

      The default matching algorithm can be changed for a given rule by calling the matcher() method.

    • For a finish rule, the rule is fired once when the job finishes (when all other tasks have finished). For each task in the rule's task group, an instance of the task subclass is constructed, and the task's main() method is called, passing in the task's command line arguments. The task may read and take tuples from tuple space and put tuples into tuple space. However, no on-demand rules will be fired when finish tasks put tuples into tuple space.

    For further information about execution of a job, see class Job.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Rule.Matcher
      Interface Rule.Matcher specifies the interface for an object that matches an on-demand Rule's templates against the tuples in tuple space.

    • Method Detail

      • atStart

        public Rule atStart()
        Specify that this rule is a start rule. If the firing condition is not specified, this rule is a start rule by default.
        Returns:
        This rule.

      • whenMatch

        public Rule whenMatch(Tuple template)
        Specify that this rule is an on-demand rule, and add the given template to this rule's list of templates.
        Parameters:
        template - Template.
        Returns:
        This rule.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if template is null.

      • atFinish

        public Rule atFinish()
        Specify that this rule is a finish rule.
        Returns:
        This rule.

      • matcher

        public Rule matcher(Rule.Matcher matcher)
        Specify the matcher for this rule. The matcher encapsulates the algorithm that matches an on-demand rule's templates against the tuples in tuple space. If not specified, the default matching algorithm is used, as described above.
        Parameters:
        matcher - Matcher.
        Returns:
        This rule.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if matcher is null.

      • task

        public <T extends Task> TaskSpec task(Class<T> taskClass)
        Add the given task to this rule's task group. When this rule fires, one instance of the given task will be executed. Call methods on the returned TaskSpec object to configure the task.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Task data type.
        Parameters:
        taskClass - Task subclass.
        Returns:
        Task specification for the given task.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if taskClass is null.

      • task

        public <T extends Task> TaskSpec task(int copies,
                             Class<T> taskClass)
        Add the given number of copies of the given task to this rule's task group. When this rule fires, the given number of instances of the given task will be executed. Call methods on the returned TaskSpec object to configure the tasks (all copies will be configured the same).
        Type Parameters:
        T - Task data type.
        Parameters:
        copies - Number of copies (≥ 1).
        taskClass - Task subclass.
        Returns:
        Task specification for the given task.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if copies < 1.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if taskClass is null.

      • match

        public void match(TupleSpace.Transaction transaction)
        Determine if the tuples in tuple space match the templates in this rule. The given Transaction is used to find and remove matching tuples. The matching algorithm is performed by this rule's Matcher.
        Parameters:
        transaction - Tuple space transaction.
        See Also:
        matcher(Matcher)
